dcterms:creator: H. Weiher
D.J. Mabry
A.C. Utter
dcterms:description: The ExoRomper dataset contains simulated camera images of a maneuverable model spacecraft as viewed on-orbit, along with ground truth labels of the satellite model’s pose. It is used to evaluate a pose estimation model and compare different algorithms in the context of a data lifecycle.
dcterms:title: ExoRomper dataset

dcterms:description: The WILDS benchmark is useful to evaluate the robustness of models to distribution shifts, but does not close the loop on evaluating the effect of labeling and retraining the model on the lifelong performance of the model.
dcterms:title: WILDS benchmark

dcterms:creator: Z. Lin
J. Shi
D. Pathak
D. Ramanan
dcterms:description: The CLEAR benchmark is developed for continual learning on real-world imagery, focusing on the impact of judiciously selecting which inputs to label on the downstream retraining task.
dcterms:title: CLEAR benchmark

dcterms:creator: M. Kisantal
S. Sharma
T.H. Park
D. Izzo
M. Märtens
S. D’Amico
dcterms:description: The Satellite pose estimation challenge dataset includes data, competition design, and results for estimating the pose of satellites, providing a comprehensive resource for evaluating pose estimation algorithms.
dcterms:title: Satellite pose estimation challenge dataset
